_header: For His love that bought us all dear
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 421.
_description: A song of Christ the Fleur-de-lys — four quatrains including refrain, ‘can the flowr de lyce’ (aaab) plus burden (bb): ‘Synge we all for tyme it is / Mary hath born the flowre-de-lice’

OxfBal354.First Lines:
ffor his love þat bowght vs all dereLysten lordyngis that ben
                    here…
OxfBal354.Last Lines:
That day he suffred myche payne& ther of cometh the fflowr
                    DeliceSyng we alle for tyme it isMary hath born þe flowre
                    deliceExplicit
